provisions.title: Registration of business
provisions.content: (1) A person shall not carry on any business unless that person has registered the business with the Commissioner. (2) There shall be paid for the registration the fees specified in the Schedule to this Act or such other fee as the Commissioner shall prescribe. (3) A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding 100 penalty units or imprisonment for a term not exceeding 3 months and where the offence is continued after conviction, to a further fine of 20 penalty units for each day the offence is continued. provisions.title: Application for registration
provisions.content: An application for registration of any business shall be in such form as the Commissioner shall prescribe. An application for registration of any business shall be in such form as the Commissioner shall prescribe.

provisions.title: Issue of certificate
provisions.content: Upon the submission of payment of the fee, the Commissioner shall issue a certificate of registration. Upon the submission of payment of the fee, the Commissioner shall issue a certificate of registration.

provisions.title: Display of certificate
provisions.content: (1) Subject to subsection (2) of this section, a person to whom a certificate of registration has been issued under this Act shall display the certificate conspicuously on premises of the principal place of business. provisions.title: Power to enter premises
provisions.content: (1) The Commissioner or any person authorised by the Commissioner may enter any premises or place where any business is carried on for the purpose of enforcing the provisions of this Act. provisions.content: (1) The Commissioner may determine the categories of business of self employed persons and the registration fees payable by the categories. provisions.title: Other offences
provisions.content: Any person who makes a statement in respect of an application under this Act; or in respect of an application under this Act; or to an authorised person in response to a request for information in the performance of that person’s functions under this Act, which is false, commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than 100 penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than 12 months or to both. to an authorised person in response to a request for information in the performance of that person’s functions under this Act, which is false, commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than 100 penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than 12 months or to both.

provisions.title: Offences by bodies of persons
provisions.content: (1) Where an offence is committed under this Act by a body of persons, every director, manager, partner or officer of that body corporate whose act or omission resulted in the contravention of that offence is liable on summary conviction to the penalty provided in respect of that offence. Where an offence is committed under this Act by a body of persons, every director, manager, partner or officer of that body corporate whose act or omission resulted in the contravention of that offence is liable on summary conviction to the penalty provided in respect of that offence. (2) A person shall not be treated as having committed an offence under subsection (1) if that person proves that the offence was committed without that person’s knowledge or connivance and that that person exercised due diligence to prevent the commission of the offence having regard to all the circumstances. A person shall not be treated as having committed an offence under subsection (1) if that person proves that the offence was committed without that person’s knowledge or connivance and that that person exercised due diligence to prevent the commission of the offence having regard to all the circumstances.

provisions.title: Interpretation
provisions.content: In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires“business” includes any trade, profession or vocation, but not employment.“Commissioner” means the Commissioner of Internal Revenue.
